attributes.action: reconsider the treatment disabled receive whilst on Incapacity Benefit
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Im a disabled man of 27 with severe Fibromyalgia my condition is not visable & cannot be confirmed by blood tests. Diagnosis is through a series of elimination.

Carers visit 3 times a day to look after me, whilst my partner works. I do voluntary work from home when I can.

I have an electric wheelchair & a wheelchair car on the Motability scheme, along with an adapted bungalow for which we are grateful.

Lately there has been alot of talk about disabled people taking advantage of the system & I take offence to this. I have IB reviews every 18 months despite a recovery being unlikely. There are some people who abuse the system, but there are genuine people who suffer everyday like me and hearing all these new policies is frightening and I want to be left alone as life is difficult enough.

The review doctors are not very nice & do not understand my condition, its frightening. Please can you stop picking on us, we didnt ask be be ill. I receive less in benefits per year than the average MP claims for 1 month. There are other ways to cut money without picking on vulnerable people.
